title: cellranger_multi
description: A pipeline for running Cell Ranger multi.

input.description: The fastq.gz files to align. Can also be a single directory containing fastq.gz files.

gex_reference.description: Genome refence index built by Cell Ranger mkref.

vdj_reference.description: VDJ refence index built by Cell Ranger mkref.

feature_reference.description: Path to the Feature reference CSV file, declaring Feature Barcode
feature_reference.help_text:
Path to the Feature reference CSV file, declaring Feature Barcode
constructs and associated barcodes. Required only for Antibody Capture 
or CRISPR Guide Capture libraries. See 
https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/software/pipelines/latest/using/feature-bc-analysis#feature-ref 
for more information.

uns_metrics.description: Name of the .uns slot under which to QC metrics (if any).

cell_multiplex_sample_id.description: A name to identify a multiplexed sample. Must be alphanumeric with hyphens and/or underscores,
cell_multiplex_sample_id.help_text:
A name to identify a multiplexed sample. Must be alphanumeric with hyphens and/or underscores, 
and less than 64 characters. Required for Cell Multiplexing libraries.

cell_multiplex_oligo_ids.description: The Cell Multiplexing oligo IDs used to multiplex this sample.
cell_multiplex_oligo_ids.help_text:
The Cell Multiplexing oligo IDs used to multiplex this sample.
If multiple CMOs were used for a sample, separate IDs with a pipe (e.g., CMO301|CMO302).
Required for Cell Multiplexing libraries.

gene expression arguments.title: Gene expression arguments
gene expression arguments.description: Arguments relevant to the analysis of gene expression data.

gex_expect_cells.description: Expected number of recovered cells, used as input to cell calling algorithm.

gex_chemistry.help_text:
Assay configuration.
- auto: autodetect mode
- threeprime: Single Cell 3'
- fiveprime: Single Cell 5'
- SC3Pv1: Single Cell 3' v1
- SC3Pv2: Single Cell 3' v2
- SC3Pv3: Single Cell 3' v3
- SC3Pv3LT: Single Cell 3' v3 LT
- SC3Pv3HT: Single Cell 3' v3 HT
- SC5P-PE: Single Cell 5' paired-end
- SC5P-R2: Single Cell 5' R2-only
- SC-FB: Single Cell Antibody-only 3' v2 or 5'
See https://kb.10xgenomics.com/hc/en-us/articles/115003764132-How-does-Cell-Ranger-auto-detect-chemistry- for more information.

gex_secondary_analysis.description: Whether or not to run the secondary analysis e.g. clustering.

gex_generate_bam.description: Whether to generate a BAM file.

gex_include_introns.description: Include intronic reads in count (default=true unless --target-panel is specified in which case default=false)

library_id.description: The Illumina sample name to analyze. This must exactly match the 'Sample Name' part
library_id.help_text:
The Illumina sample name to analyze. This must exactly match the 'Sample Name' part
of the FASTQ files specified in the `--input` argument.

library_type.description: The underlying feature type of the library.
library_type.help_text:
The underlying feature type of the library.
Possible values: "Gene Expression", "VDJ", "VDJ-T", "VDJ-B", "Antibody Capture", "CRISPR Guide Capture", "Multiplexing Capture"

library_subsample.description: Optional. The rate at which reads from the provided FASTQ files are sampled.
library_subsample.help_text:
Optional. The rate at which reads from the provided FASTQ files are sampled.
Must be strictly greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

library_lanes.description: Lanes associated with this sample. Defaults to using all lanes.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
